Yesterday, @FLOTUS announced April 22, 2019, as this year’s @WhiteHouse Easter Egg Roll. Families with children 13-years-old and younger can enter the lottery to attend February 28 through March 4. Further details can be found online: https://www.whitehouse.gov/eastereggroll/
The @SocialSecurity Administration also provides tools for retirement planning. Learn more at  http://www.socialsecurity.gov/planners/retire
I continue to push for action to take additional steps forward to make it easier for Idahoans to save for retirement.  I encourage Idahoans to set a goal, make a plan and save automatically. #ASW19
Through Saturday, this week has been designated as #AmericaSavesWeek.  Preparing for retirement years is often difficult, especially when paychecks have to cover a multitude of important obligations.

Given the exponential growth and use of data, it is worth examining how the Fair Credit Reporting Act should work in a digital economy, and whether certain data brokers and other firms serve a function similar to the original consumer reporting agencies. https://www.banking.senate.gov/newsroom/majority/crapo-statement-at-semiannual-monetary-policy-report …

Overseeing the full implementation of the Economic Growth, Regulatory Relief and Consumer Protection Act, as well as the federal banking agencies’ rules to right-size regulations, will continue to be a top priority of the Committee this Congress.  https://www.banking.senate.gov/newsroom/majority/crapo-statement-at-semiannual-monetary-policy-report …

The Federal Reserve’s Semiannual Monetary Policy Report to the Congress provides the Banking Committee an opportunity to examine the current state of the U.S. economy, the Fed’s implementation of monetary policy, and its supervisory and regulatory activities. pic.twitter.com/u6cKnQF0FW

I supported the Born-Alive Abortion Survivors Protection Act tonight because our devotion to fostering respect for human life from the moment of conception to natural death will benefit generations to come.

I supported this legislation to overhaul the complex and backlogged appeals process to make it simpler, more navigable and more accessible to veterans. More information about the new appeals process can be found here:  https://www.benefits.va.gov/benefits/appeals.asp …
Good news for veterans: the VA just announced the roll-out of the new and improved multi-track appeals process mandated by the Veterans Appeals Improvement and Modernization Act of 2017.

I voted today to confirm William Barr as our next Attorney General.  I am confident in his qualifications and know he will look first to the Constitution for guidance to ensure fair and equal justice under the law.

I am particularly interested in what #data is contained in modern consumer reports, how the information is gathered, who compiles it, how it is protected, how consumers can access it and correct it, and how #privacy is respected.

My colleague, @SenSherrodBrown and I invite feedback from interested stakeholders on the collection, use and protection of sensitive information by financial regulators and private companies.  More info can be found on the @BankingGOP website: https://www.banking.senate.gov/newsroom/majority/crapo-brown-invite-feedback-on-data-privacy-protection-and-collection …

I intend to support his nomination when it comes before the full Senate and urge his swift confirmation.

Having met with Barr as part of his confirmation process, I am confident of his qualifications, his independence and his commitment to looking to the Constitution for guidance to ensure fair and equal justice under law.
William Barr has served our nation previously as Attorney General, and today I voted to again confirm him to this important position as our nation’s top law enforcement official.
